## Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) Template

```markdown
# Work Breakdown Structure: [Project Name]

## 1. Project Initiation
  ### 1.1 Project Charter
    #### 1.1.1 Draft charter
    #### 1.1.2 Review charter
    #### 1.1.3 Finalize charter
  ### 1.2 Stakeholder Identification
    #### 1.2.1 Identify stakeholders
    #### 1.2.2 Analyze stakeholder requirements
    #### 1.2.3 Document stakeholder register

## 2. Data Collection and Preparation
  ### 2.1 Data Source Identification
    #### 2.1.1 Research available sources
    #### 2.1.2 Evaluate source quality
    #### 2.1.3 Document source metadata
  ### 2.2 Data Extraction
    #### 2.2.1 Develop extraction scripts
    #### 2.2.2 Schedule extraction jobs
    #### 2.2.3 Monitor extraction process
  ### 2.3 Data Cleaning
    #### 2.3.1 Identify data quality issues
    #### 2.3.2 Implement cleaning routines
    #### 2.3.3 Validate cleaned data

## 3. Data Analysis
  ### 3.1 Exploratory Analysis
    #### 3.1.1 Perform statistical analysis
    #### 3.1.2 Identify patterns and trends
    #### 3.1.3 Document initial findings
  ### 3.2 In-depth Analysis
    #### 3.2.1 Apply analytical techniques
    #### 3.2.2 Test hypotheses
    #### 3.2.3 Document analysis results

## 4. Visualization and Reporting
  ### 4.1 Dashboard Development
    #### 4.1.1 Design dashboard layout
    #### 4.1.2 Implement visualizations
    #### 4.1.3 Test dashboard functionality
  ### 4.2 Report Creation
    #### 4.2.1 Draft report content
    #### 4.2.2 Review and revise
    #### 4.2.3 Finalize report

## 5. Project Closure
  ### 5.1 Documentation
    #### 5.1.1 Compile project documentation
    #### 5.1.2 Archive project files
    #### 5.1.3 Update knowledge base
  ### 5.2 Project Review
    #### 5.2.1 Conduct lessons learned session
    #### 5.2.2 Document best practices
    #### 5.2.3 Present final project summary
```

## RACI Matrix Template

```markdown
# RACI Matrix: [Project Name]

| Task/Deliverable | [Stakeholder 1] | [Stakeholder 2] | [Stakeholder 3] | [Stakeholder 4] |
|------------------|-----------------|-----------------|-----------------|-----------------|
| [Task 1]         | R               | A               | C               | I               |
| [Task 2]         | C               | R               | A               | I               |
| [Task 3]         | I               | C               | R               | A               |
| [Task 4]         | A               | R               | I               | C               |

**Legend**:
- **R (Responsible)**: Person who performs the work
- **A (Accountable)**: Person ultimately answerable for the work
- **C (Consulted)**: Person who provides input before work is done
- **I (Informed)**: Person who is kept up-to-date on progress
```

- Technical

- Resource
- Data Quality
- Stakeholder
- External

**Risk Score Calculation**:
- High Probability + High Impact = High Risk (9)
- High Probability + Medium Impact = High Risk (6)
- Medium Probability + High Impact = High Risk (6)
- Medium Probability + Medium Impact = Medium Risk (4)
- Low Probability + High Impact = Medium Risk (3)
- High Probability + Low Impact = Medium Risk (3)
- Medium Probability + Low Impact = Low Risk (2)
- Low Probability + Medium Impact = Low Risk (2)
- Low Probability + Low Impact = Low Risk (1)

## How to Use These Templates

1. Copy the template markdown.
2. Replace all placeholders (text within `[brackets]`) with project-specific information.
3. Save the completed template in the project documentation repository.
4. Update as needed throughout the project lifecycle.

These templates are designed to be flexible and can be adapted to fit the specific needs of your project.
